intro: Oldenlandia hirtula, commonly known as the hairy oldenlandia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered with fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The small white or yellow flowers are clustered in cymes and are often accompanied by bracts that are hairy and glandular.
